stlib.util

Class GeneralHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • stlib.util.GeneralHelper

  • public final class GeneralHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some useful methods for calculation and comparison
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static double epsilon
      Epsilon value Two floating point numbers are considered equal if their difference is less than the static variable epsilon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private GeneralHelper()
      Only helper class, no instances allowed

    • Method Detail

      • almostEqual

        public static boolean almostEqual(double d0,
                                  double d1)
        Verifys if the passed values are almost equal. This means that the two values are considered equal if they differ by less than the value epsilon.
        Parameters:
        d0 - - first value
        d1 - - second value
        Returns:
        true if both values almost equal, false otherwise

        Calculate the simple distance between two double values
        Parameters:

        d1 - - second double value
        Returns:
        the absolute distance

      • distanceEuclidean

        public static double distanceEuclidean(double x0,
                                       double y0,
                                       double x1,
                                       double y1)
        Calculate the euclidean distance between the passed values which are interpreted as coordinates of two points in the euclidean space
        Parameters:
        x0 - - x value of first point
        y0 - - y value of first point
        x1 - - x value of second point
        y1 - - y value of second point
        Returns:
        the euclidean distance

      • distanceOrthodrome

        public static double distanceOrthodrome(double lat0,
                                        double lon0,
                                        double lat1,
                                        double lon1)
        Calculates the spherical distance between two geographical points, a orthodrome, specified by passed latitude and longitude values with an accuracy of 50 metres. The orthodrome is the shortest connection of two points on a sphere surface.
        The values have to be passed in decimal degree e.g. 52.5183252d and 13.4081446d

        The calculation is based on a WGS84 ellipsoid
        Parameters:
        lat0 - - latitude of first point
        lon0 - - longitude of first point
        lat1 - - latitude of second point
        lon1 - - longitude of second point
        Returns:
        the geographic distance in metres

      • counterClockwisePath

        public static int counterClockwisePath(PointIF p0,
                                       PointIF p1,
                                       PointIF p2)
        Check if one moves counterclockwise when following the points p0 -> p1 -> p2
        Parameters:
        p0 -
        p1 -
        p2 -
        Returns:
        1 : move counter clockwise
        -1 : move clockwise
        0 :

      • determinePositionRatio

        public static double determinePositionRatio(PointIF point,
                                            PointIF startPoint,
                                            PointIF endPoint)
        Determines the position of the first point in relation to the other two.
        If all three points are on a line, a value between 0 and 1 indicates the ratio between the other two points.
        Parameters:
        point - - the point whose position is to be determined
        startPoint -
        endPoint -
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 1 indicates the ratio between the other two points
        See Also:
        https://github.com/Strilanc/Methods

      • intersection

        public static java.util.List<CrossPointScalars> intersection(PointIF fixedPoint,
                                                             PointIF initStartPoint,
                                                             PointIF finalStartPoint,
                                                             PointIF initEndPoint,
                                                             PointIF finalEndPoint)
        This method determines the intersections of a moving line with a fixed point in the form of time and positions scalars. Depending on how the line moves, more than one intersection point is possible.
        Parameters:
        fixedPoint - - the fixed point
        initStartPoint - - initial start point of the moving line
        finalStartPoint - - - final start point of the moving line
        initEndPoint - - initial end point of the moving line
        finalEndPoint - - final end point of the moving line
        Returns:
        a List of 'CrossPointScalars' data objects with the determined scalars
        See Also:
        https://github.com/Strilanc/Methods

      • quadraticRoots

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> quadraticRoots(double a,
                                                              double b,
                                                              double c)
        Enumerates the real solutions to the formula a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0.
        Handles degenerate cases.
        If a=b=c=0 then only zero is enumerated, even though technically all real numbers are solutions.
        Parameters:
        a - - coefficient a*x^2
        b - - coefficient b*x
        c - - coefficient c
        Returns:
        solutions as list of Double values
        See Also:
        https://github.com/Strilanc/Methods

      • getEpsilon

        public static double getEpsilon()
        Get the epsilon value
        Returns:
        the epsilon

        public static void setEpsilon(double epsilon)
        Set the epsilon value
        Parameters:
        epsilon - the epsilon to set
